item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I would always rather be happy than dignified." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Carol Shields
item.description: "Open a book this minute and start reading. Don’t move until you’ve reached page fifty. Until you’ve buried your thoughts in print. Cover yourself with words. Wash yourself away. Dissolve." -- Carol Shields

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Ted Hughes
item.description: "The only calibration that counts is how much heart people invest, how much they ignore their fears of being hurt or caught out or humiliated. And the only thing people regret is that they didn't live boldly enough, that they didn't invest enough heart, didn't love enough. Nothing else really counts at all." -- Ted Hughes

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "Do one thing every day that scares you." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Desmond Tutu
item.description: "Do your little bit of good where you are; it's those little bits of good put together that overwhelm the world." -- Desmond Tutu

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Napoleon Hill
item.description: "The starting point of all achievement is DESIRE. Keep this constantly in mind. Weak desire brings weak results, just as a small fire makes a small amount of heat." -- Napoleon Hill

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "I want to stand as close to the edge as I can without going over. Out on the edge you see all kinds of things you can't see from the center." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by William Arthur Ward
item.description: "The pessimist complains about the wind; the optimist expects it to change; the realist adjusts the sails." -- William Arthur Ward

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Rebecca West
item.description: "I myself have never been able to find out precisely what feminism is: I only know that people call me a feminist whenever I express sentiments that differentiate me from a doormat." -- Rebecca West

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Bette Davis
item.description: "When a man gives his opinion, he's a man. When a woman gives her opinion, she's a bitch." -- Bette Davis

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Sheng Wang
item.description: "Why do people say "grow some balls"? Balls are weak and sensitive. If you wanna be tough, grow a vagina. Those things can take a pounding." -- Sheng Wang

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Cheris Kramarae
item.description: "Feminism is the radical notion that women are human beings." -- Cheris Kramarae

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "There comes a time when one must take a position that is neither safe, nor politic, nor popular, but he must take it because conscience tells him it is right." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Edward Albee
item.description: "You're alive only once, as far as we know, and what could be worse than getting to the end of your life and realizing you hadn't lived it?" -- Edward Albee

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Richard P. Feynman
item.description: "Nobody ever figures out what life is all about, and it doesn't matter. Explore the world. Nearly everything is really interesting if you go into it deeply enough." -- Richard P. Feynman

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description: "Love doesn't just sit there, like a stone, it has to be made, like bread; remade all the time, made new." -- Ursula K. Le Guin

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Zadie Smith
item.description: "The past is always tense, the future perfect." -- Zadie Smith

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Anne Tyler
item.description: "I read so I can live more than one life in more than one place." -- Anne Tyler

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Corrie Ten Boom
item.description: "Worry does not empty tomorrow of its sorrow, it empties today of its strength." -- Corrie Ten Boom

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Robert Louis Stevenson
item.description: "There is no duty we so much underrate as the duty of being happy. By being happy we sow anonymous benefits upon the world." -- Robert Louis Stevenson

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Astrid Lindgren
item.description: "Give the children love, more love and still more love – and the common sense will come by itself." -- Astrid Lindgren

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Lenore Hershey
item.description: "Do give books - religious or otherwise - for Christmas. They’re never fattening, seldom sinful, and permanently personal." -- Lenore Hershey

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Jenny Joseph
item.description: "When I am an old woman I shall wear purple. With a red hat which doesn't go, and doesn't suit me." -- Jenny Joseph

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Margaret Fuller
item.description: "Today a reader, tomorrow a leader." -- Margaret Fuller

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Ian Fleming
item.description: "Never say 'no' to adventures. Always say 'yes,' otherwise you'll lead a very dull life." -- Ian Fleming

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "When I was a boy of 14, my father was so ignorant I could hardly stand to have the old man around. But when I got to be 21, I was astonished at how much the old man had learned in seven years." -- Mark Twain
